SENT.plain: A 16-year-old girl developed acute left choreic movements during her fourth week of pregnancy
She had sometimes had transient ischemic attacks since she was 10 years old
During the eighth week of pregnancy, a brain MRI showed old ischemic lesions deep in the right frontal white matter
Her angiograph revealed a complete obstruction of the terminal portion of the right internal carotid artery with a developed moyamoya net work
After her abortion, all involuntary movements completely subsided
The choreic movements might have been caused not only by ischemia, but also by enhanced dopaminergic sensitivity mediated by elevations in female sex hormones due to pregnancy
